title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Southward, a little way out of Winchburgh, at the grey ruin of Niddrie Castle, one comes again within the atmosphere of charm that everywhere, strangely, seems to haunt the spots associated with the fortunes of Mary Stuart. The castle belonged to the Earl of Wintoun, head of the house of Seaton, who remained constantly loyal to the Queen throughout her troubles, and whose descendant, two hundred years later, was to be as loyal and as unfortunate in the cause of her last direct representative, Prince Charles Edward.
